name: Audubons Cottontail
overview: Audubon’s cottontail is a small mammal defined by its bushy white tail, which resembles a cotton ball. The rest of their bodies are a mix of browns and greys, with some white on their undersides.
behavior: Audubon’s cottontails actively forage during early morning and evenings. They spend the rest of their days in hiding.
habitat: This species can be found throughout the Vernal Pools and Grassland Reserve. They can even be seen grazing on campus lawns. They live and nest in underground holes that they line with grasses and fur.
size: 14-17 inches in length with ears 2.4-3.5 inches long
tags: sylvilagus adubonii audubons cottontail small mammal white tail brown grey mammals animal animals
